newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh arrests 36 suspected Indian insurgents.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh arrests 36 suspected Indian insurgents.

text.p: Bangladesh border guards on Monday arrested 36 Indians suspected of being involved in separatist insurgencies in northeast India, police said.
They said the group, including a woman, was detained at Jafflong in Sylhet district, bordering India's Manipur state.
"All those arrested speak Manipuri language," one police officer told reporters. They were being interrogated, he said without giving further details.
Bangladesh border guards arrested four suspected Indian insurgents on April 16 at a frontier village not far from Sylhet, police said.
Police on Monday declined to give further details.
Bangladesh and India agreed to help each other fight insurgents during a visit to Dhaka in January by former Indian prime minister H.D. Deve Gowda.

Border officials of the two countries earlier this month agreed at a meeting in New Delhi not to give shelter to "terrorists", including insurgents operating across their frontiers, government officials said.
